description: The Ministry of Education, Science and Technology of Antigua and Barbuda closed the schools early on the 16th of march. School staff and teachers had to prepare the closing on the 16th and the 17th of March.
type_sub_cat: Primary Schools (generally for children ages 10 and below)
enforcer: Ministry/Department of Health,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: The Ministry of Education, Science and Technology of Antigua and Barbuda closed the schools early on the 16th of march. School staff and teachers had to prepare the closing on the 16th and the 17th of March.
type_sub_cat: Secondary Schools (generally for children ages 10 to 18)
enforcer: Ministry/Department of Health,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: The government of Antigua and Barbuda imposes a nationwide 24 hour curfew on the 2nd of April until April the 9th. A curfew from 8PM to 6AM had been imposed earlier on the 27th of March and should have lasted until the 11th of April. UPDATE: The original night curfew from the 28th of March has been extended to a 24 hour curfew starting at the 2nd of April. The new curfew is set for one week, while the prior one should be in place for two weeks.
compliance: Mandatory with Legal Penalties (Jail Time),Mandatory with Fines,Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)

description: The government of Antigua and Barbuda is enforcing a nationwide curfew with few exceptions from 28th of March for two weeks. The curfew will be in place from 8PM to 6AM. UPDATE: The curfew has been extended until June 12. It lasts from 9pm until 5am. Beaches, religious activities and some sport activities are open and allowed again.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
compliance: Mandatory (Unspecified/Implied),Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)

description: On March the 27th, the government of Antigua and Barbuda has declared an state of emergency.
compliance: Mandatory (Unspecified/Implied),Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)

description: On 31 March the government of Antigua and Barbuda announced that the state of emergency, which began on 25 March, would last until 23 May. UPDATE: On 31 March the government of Antigua and Barbuda announced that the state of emergency, which began on 25 March, would be extended until 23 May.
compliance: Mandatory with Legal Penalties (Jail Time),Mandatory with Fines,Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)

description: The government of Antigua and Barbuda has declared state of emergency and imposes a nationwide 24 hour curfew until April the 9th. A curfew from 8PM to 6AM had been imposed earlier on the 27th of March and should have lasted until the 11th of April. UPDATE: The original declaration of emergency on the 27th of March included a curfew from 8 PM to 6 AM and should last untill the 11th of April. The new declaration includes a 24 hour curfew starting on the 2nd of April. The new curfew should last until the 9th of April.
compliance: Mandatory with Legal Penalties (Jail Time),Mandatory with Fines,Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)

description: The government of Antigua and Barbuda has declared state of emergency and imposes a nationwide 24 hour curfew until April the 9th. A curfew from 8PM to 6AM had been imposed earlier on the 27th of March and should have lasted until the 11th of April. There are few exceptions to the rule. UPDATE: The government of Antigua and Barbuda extended the 24 hour quarantine to the 16th of April. The original 24 hour quarantine should last from the 2nd to the 9th of April.
compliance: Mandatory with Legal Penalties (Jail Time),Mandatory with Fines,Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)

description: The government of Antigua and Barbuda has declared state of emergency and imposes a nationwide 24 hour curfew until April the 9th. The 24 hour curfew was first extended until April the 16th and then until April the 22nd. There are some exceptions to the curfew. UPDATE: The Government of Antigua and Barbuda is extending the current 24 hour curfew and the state of emergency until April 22. Previously it was stated, that the 24 hour curfew would last until April 16. Since April 16, citizens are allowed to go for sport activities outside alone or with one other person. Security distance has to be respected at all times.
compliance: Mandatory with Legal Penalties (Jail Time),Mandatory with Fines,Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)

description: On March the 27th, the government of Antigua and Barbuda has declared an state of emergency. UPDATE: The state of emergency has been extended until 12 June. The 24 hour curfew has been reduced to the night from 9pm to 5am. More shops and restaurants are allowed to open now. Beaches are also open to the public again during certain hours.
compliance: Mandatory (Unspecified/Implied),Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)

description: On March the 27th, the government of Antigua and Barbuda has declared an state of emergency. UPDATE: The state of emergency in Barbuda and Antigua is extended until 31 of July.
compliance: Mandatory (Unspecified/Implied),Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)

description: At the 16th of March, Antigua and Barbuda´s Tourism Authority stated: "If you have travelled from China, Italy, Iran, Japan, Korea, Germany, France and Singapore within the past twenty-eight (28) days you will not be allowed entry. Citizens of Antigua and Barbuda as well as resident diplomats will be allowed entry"
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
compliance: Mandatory (Unspecified/Implied),Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)
enforcer: National Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: "On 24 March the government of Antigua and Barbuda announced with immediate effect the consolidation of its maritime border on the island of Antigua. All international maritime arrivals must enter via Nevis Street Pier in St John’s." "Yachts are not permitted to enter Antigua and Barbuda, regardless of which country they have arrived from, and regardless of the nationality or residential status of those on board. Travellers arriving from Montserrat are being screened, which may result in extended travel time."

The government of Antigua and Barbuda closed the only international airport for all incoming flights on the 26th of March. An exception are cargo aircraft, private jets and island hopping planes. UPDATE: The entry restriction for few countries on the 16th of March was extended to a closure of the airport for all incoming flights on the 26th of March. An exception are cargo aircraft, private jets and island hopper planes.
compliance: Mandatory (Unspecified/Implied),Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)

description: The existing travel ban for some countries has been expanded for foreign nationals, who have visited the United States, Canada and all European countries in the 28 days before. All incoming foreign flights have been cancelled. These new measures are starting at the 26th of March according to the government of Antigua and Barbuda. UPDATE: By March 25th, the government decided to extend the travel ban of foreign nationals who have been in more countries than before. The newly included countries now include the United States, Canada and all European states.
target_who_what: All Foreign Nationals (Foreign Residents + Foreign Travelers)
compliance: Mandatory (Unspecified/Implied),Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)

description: "On 24 March the Barbuda Council announced that from 27 March all ports of entry on the island of Barbuda will be closed for 14 days." Previously the regulation had no specific duration and one pier was still opened for incoming travelers by boat. UPDATE: "On 24 March the Barbuda Council announced that from 27 March all ports of entry on the island of Barbuda will be closed for 14 days."

At the 16th of March, Antigua and Barbuda´s Tourism Authority stated: "If you have travelled from China, Italy, Iran, Japan, Korea, Germany, France and Singapore within the past twenty-eight (28) days you will not be allowed entry. Citizens of Antigua and Barbuda as well as resident diplomats will be allowed entry" UPDATE: Starting on June 1st, travelers from all countries are allowed to enter the country again. The international airport opens up again. Several hygiene and test protocolls will be implemented.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
compliance: Mandatory (Unspecified/Implied),Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)
enforcer: National Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: "All people out on essential business must wear a masks that covers the nose and mouth, including when in motor vehicles." This measure applies to all visitors and residents in Antigua and Barbuda during the lockdown.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
compliance: Mandatory with Legal Penalties (Jail Time),Mandatory with Fines

description: The UK is providing 3.8m US$ for Covid-19 responses in the Caribbean. Also Antigua and Barbuda will benefit from the money. This was announced on May 22nd. The Pan American Health Organisation (PAHO) will receive the money and help the contributing nations with e.g. health ressources.

The Ministry of Public Utilities, Civil Aviation, Transportation and Energy of Antigua and Barbuda released a Travel Advisory on May 22nd. There it presented the hygiene protocols for the reopening of the island on June 1st. Measures like a negative Covid-19 test, eventual quarantine and special certifications are published.
enforcer: National Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: In an official statement of the Government of Antigua and Barbuda on April 22 it was stated that: "In addition to social distancing, owners of businesses permitted operate during the curfew period shall ensure that there is a sanitizing station available at the entry to the business and sanitary procedures are observed by all customers."
The government of Antigua and Barbuda is enforcing a nationwide curfew with few exceptions from 28th of March for two weeks. The curfew will be in place from 8PM to 6AM.
type_sub_cat: Lockdown only applies to people of certain ages (Please note the age restriction in the text box)
compliance: Mandatory (Unspecified/Implied),Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)

type_sub_cat: Lockdown only applies to people of certain ages (Please note the age restriction in the text box)
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

type_sub_cat: Lockdown only applies to people of certain ages (Please note the age restriction in the text box)

description: Prime Minister Gaston Browne announced that a seven-day lockdown will begin one second after midnight (local time) on Thursday, 3 April, as part of efforts to tackle the spread of coronavirus (COVID-19). An existing curfew from 20:00 to 06:00 will be replaced by a 24-hour curfew, with all but nonessential workers prohibited from leaving their homes. Supermarkets will only be open for limited hours.
type_sub_cat: Lockdown only applies to people of certain ages (Please note the age restriction in the text box)
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
compliance: Mandatory (Unspecified/Implied),Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)

description: On March the 16th, Antigua Public Utilities Authority (APUA) created an internal taskforce to recommend systematic business continuity plans that can be implemented within Antigua and Barbuda.
type: New Task Force, Bureau or Administrative Configuration

description: The Antigua and Barbuda Prime Minister is noting on March 31 that the government has already spent EC$20 million (One EC dollar=US$0.37 cents) on preparing for the virus.
type_text: Unspecified government spending in order to prevent the spread of Covid-19.

description: "The Caribbean Development Bank (CDB) is making available emergency loans to seven Caribbean countries, in the first instance, to finance the response to the COVID-19 pandemic." On May 18th, the Bank’s Board of Directors has approved US$13 million for Antigua and Barbuda.
type_text: The Caribbean Developement Bank granted a emergency loan over US$ 13 million to Antigua and Barbuda on May the 18th.

description: With the curfew imposed in Antigua and Barbuda from the 28th of March, all non-essential services and businesses are to remain closed for two weeks.
compliance: Mandatory (Unspecified/Implied),Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)

description:
The Government of Antigua and Barbuda allowed a relaxation of the nationwide business restrictions on 16th of April:
"Among the essential services added to the list allowed to operate were hardware stores, mechanics, and chandleries to enable yachts to stock up on marine supplies. Dentists may now treat patients but must pay extra special care to decontaminating their instruments, Cabinet warned. Supermarkets are being encouraged to operate online sales and deliveries but will remain open from 7am until 12pm. Banks and other financial institutions may also open daily for the same five-hour period.
Mechanics can operate as needed, while automobile spare parts stores may also operate online, telephone and delivery services." UPDATE: From April the 16th on, some more businesses are allowed to open. Those include hardware stores, mechanics, and chandleries to enable yachts to stock up on marine supplies. Previously, only the most relevant businesses were allowed to remain open.
compliance: Mandatory (Unspecified/Implied),Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)

description: With the curfew imposed in Antigua and Barbuda from the 28th of March, all non-essential services and businesses are to remain closed for two weeks. UPDATE: On May 1st, some selected stores on the open air shopping center "Heritage Quay" in St. Johns on the island of Antigua and Barbuda reopened. This was published on may 4th by the Antigua Cruise Port. Additional hygiene measures were taken. Most other non-essential stores remain closed.
compliance: Mandatory (Unspecified/Implied),Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)

description: The government of Antigua and Barbuda announced on the 22nd of March, that gatherings of more than 25 persons are prohibited. In a media statement of the government from the 25th of March, the officials recognized multiple violations of the restriction.
type_sub_cat: Postponement of an annually recurring event

description: "No person shall–host or attend at any private party which includes any person from outside of his or her immediate household occupant; attend or participate in any organised sporting event or any sports stadium; hold any banquet, ball or reception; any social event. For the duration of the curfew period –weddings; meeting of a fraternal society, social or private club, civic organisation or association,are banned. Funerals, if held during the curfew period, must be conducted in the cemetery with no more than ten mourners, the  officiant,  two  representative  from  the  funeral  home  and  two  persons  employed  to  work  in  the  graveyard,  all  of whom shall practice social distancing and wear a face mask." UPDATE: From the 2nd of April, all gatherings in Antigua and Barbuda are prohibited. Funerals are the only exceptions.
type_sub_cat: Postponement of an annually recurring event

description:
"Prison visits and court cases across Antigua and Barbuda are suspended for two weeks to reduce the risk of coronavirus (COVID-19) transmissions. The Ministry said the suspension of prison visits also affects food and water drop-offs for inmates. Only the Prison Farm Gang members can enter and leave Her Majesty’s Prison. At the courts, some trials that have already started will continue and emergency applications heard but the Magistrates Court will continue to function under a very strict regulatory regime.
The Civil Registry will operate a next day service, where a drop box will be provided for drop-offs, while emergency applications will be facilitated.
Only three people will be allowed to enter the Land Registry and Intellectual Property Departments at a time.
The Legal Aid and Advice Centre will also be limiting public contact to one person per session. Scheduled interview sessions will be done via telephone and a drop off box will be provided for required documents."
type_sub_cat: Keeping a distance of at least 6 feet or 1.5 meters apart

description:
"Prison visits and court cases across Antigua and Barbuda are suspended for two weeks to reduce the risk of coronavirus (COVID-19) transmissions. The Ministry said the suspension of prison visits also affects food and water drop-offs for inmates. Only the Prison Farm Gang members can enter and leave Her Majesty’s Prison. At the courts, some trials that have already started will continue and emergency applications heard but the Magistrates Court will continue to function under a very strict regulatory regime.
The Civil Registry will operate a next day service, where a drop box will be provided for drop-offs, while emergency applications will be facilitated.
Only three people will be allowed to enter the Land Registry and Intellectual Property Departments at a time.
The Legal Aid and Advice Centre will also be limiting public contact to one person per session. Scheduled interview sessions will be done via telephone and a drop off box will be provided for required documents."
type_sub_cat: Wearing Masks in all public spaces/everywhere

description: A statement by the Antigua Public Utility Authority informed the public about social distancing and hygiene measures on March 16th. "Senior citizens will be given priority in customer lines, to limit exposure, controlled lines at our payment centers will be enforced, utilization of sanitization stationswill be made compulsory upon entrance of offices, a designated waiting area will be provided to facilitate the recommended social distance."
type_sub_cat: Keeping a distance of at least 6 feet or 1.5 meters apart

description: Even though the Government of Antigua and Barbuda introduced a curfew before, the official statement published on April 22 included detailed social distancing rules for businesses, which are allowed to open during the curfew. "Ensure that all customers and staff maintain physical distancing of no less than six feet in or around their business; determine the number of persons that may be permitted in the establishment at any one time by permitting one person for every fifty square feet of store space; place distance markers at six feet interval showing where persons are permitted to stand at a check out point; place distance markers at six feet interval to show where persons are permitted to stand while waiting outside of the establishment"
type_sub_cat: Keeping a distance of at least 6 feet or 1.5 meters apart
compliance: Mandatory with Legal Penalties (Jail Time),Mandatory with Fines
